subject: Re: [d@DCC] MS censors UN document
body:
This is certainly true but very very old news (2005) and widely noted,
discussed and assimilated into on-going (and more up to date) discourse...

MG

> MS censors UN document
>
> "Microsoft asked for references to free software to be removed from a
> document presented at
> last week's UN World Summit on the Information Society (WSIS) conference,
> the software
> giant admitted on Friday. The Free Software Foundation Europe (FSFE) is
> unhappy that the
> document was changed and claims that even though it was on the panel
> discussing the
> document, it was not made aware of Microsoft's changes. The document
> (2.8MB PDF),
> known as the Vienna Conclusions, discusses issues around IT and
> creativity. The original
> draft of the document discussed how the free software model is changing
> the way people do
> business."
>
> http://linux.slashdot.org/article.pl?sid=05/11/25/1947219&from=rss
>
> --
> tOM Trottier 	 tOM@abacurial.com 	 +1 613 860-6633
